title: Ingredient Substitutions for Baking

items.name: Coconut sugar substitute
items.details: Replace with equal amount of brown sugar. Similar moisture content and sweetness level, works well without affecting texture.

items.name: Pumpkin pie spice substitute
items.details: Per 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice: use 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/8 tsp ginger, 1/8 tsp cloves.

items.name: Pink salt substitute
items.details: Standard table salt or sea salt in the same amount. Minimal flavor impact and no effect on baking process.

items.name: Oat flour substitute
items.details: Equal amount of all-purpose flour (if gluten is OK). For gluten-free: almond flour or GF all-purpose blend, though almond flour gives a slightly denser texture.

items.name: Melted coconut oil note
items.details: Recipes call for melted coconut oil because it is solid at room temperature and needs to be liquid to blend smoothly. If you have liquid coconut oil in a bottle, skip the melting step and use it directly.

notes: These substitutions are especially useful for banana-based baking bars that call for coconut sugar, oat flour, pumpkin pie spice, pink salt, and melted coconut oil with maple syrup.
